title: Injection failure in generated code in devmode
body:
### Describe the bug

I have an application, which uses mapstruct to generate code. When I run this app using `mvn clean quarkus:dev`, it fails with the follwoing exception: `@javax.inject.Inject declared on <..> use @jakarta.inject.Inject instead`. When I run the same app using  `mvn clean compile quarkus:dev` it works as expected.

### Expected behavior

Application should be started in devmode using `mvn clean quarkus:dev` command

### Actual behavior

```
2024-03-13 10:52:13,481 ERROR [io.qua.dep.dev.IsolatedDevModeMain] (main) Failed to start quarkus: java.lang.RuntimeException: io.quarkus.builder.BuildException: Build failure: Build failed due to errors

[2] @javax.inject.Inject declared on io.quarkus.ts.javaee.gettingstarted.mapper.ChitChatMapperImpl.chitChatDtoFactory, use @jakarta.inject.Inject instead

		at io.quarkus.arc.deployment.WrongAnnotationUsageProcessor.detect(WrongAnnotationUsageProcessor.java:68)

	at io.quarkus.arc.processor.BeanDeployment.processErrors(BeanDeployment.java:1516)

		... 9 more

		at io.quarkus.arc.deployment.WrongAnnotationUsageProcessor.detect(WrongAnnotationUsageProcessor.java:68)
		... 9 more

```

### How to Reproduce?

1. `git clone git@github.com:quarkus-qe/quarkus-test-suite.git -b 3.8 tests`
2. `cd tests/javaee-like-getting-started`
3.  `mvn clean quarkus:dev`

### Output of `uname -a` or `ver`

6.7.3-200.fc39.x86_64

### Output of `java -version`

Java version: 21.0.1, vendor: Eclipse Adoptium

### Quarkus version or git rev

3.8.1

### Build tool (ie. output of `mvnw --version` or `gradlew --version`)

Apache Maven 3.9.6 (bc0240f3c744dd6b6ec2920b3cd08dcc295161ae)

### Additional information

Stacktrace mentions a bean, which uses `componentModel = CDI`. Mapstruct doc[1] mentions, that for this model, "the generated mapper is an application-scoped (from javax.enterprise.context or jakarta.enterprise.context, depending on which one is available with javax.inject having priority) CDI bean". Is it possible, that Quarkus provides javax context for some reason?

[1] https://mapstruct.org/documentation/stable/reference/html/#configuration-options
